description: When a value is provided for {notificationId}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {notification_ID} is equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {notificationBy}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {notification_by_ID} is equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {minStartDate}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {start_date} is greater than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {maxStartDate}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {start_date} is less than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {minComments}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {count_comments} is greater than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {maxComments}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {count_comments} is less than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {minOpinions}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {count_opinions} is greater than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {maxOpinions}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {count_opinions} is less than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {commissionComment}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {commission_comment} is equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {commissionOpinion}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {commission_opinion} is equal to the provided value.
When {download=1}, the API will return a {CSV} file instead of a {json} object.
The maximum number of observations to return in a single API call. Defaults to 1000 when a value is not provided. The maximum value is 1000.

The number of observations to skip before returning observations from the filtered table. The API will return {limit} observations starting at the observation with the index {offset + 1}. Defaults to {0}. If {offset} is larger than the number of rows in the filtered table, the API will return an empty {json} array.
When a value is provided for {minYear}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {year} is greater than or equal to the provided value.
When a value is provided for {maxYear}, the API will only return observations from the requested data table where the variable {year} is less than or equal to the provided value.
